It is difficult to respond to a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual has lived all his life in exactly the same environment as another. Some of the questions will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer so do not worry about having blank spaces. The purpose of your answers is not to fill up space but to answer the questions. Don't hesitate to give details or describe particular events, i.e., they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1930, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experiences of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Western Canadian Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Days: What Did Saskatchewan Pioneers Have?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to recount?

I could go on and on about the hardships we faced, but I will not. Instead, I will share a few memories from my childhood that will hopefully inspire you to reflect on your own life.

One day, while working on our farm, my father decided to build a new barn. He spent weeks planning and preparing, but when it was finally completed, we were amazed by its size and beauty. It became a symbol of hard work and determination, and we knew that we had achieved something truly special.

Another memory that stands out is the time we went on a camping trip with my extended family. We set up camp near a river, and every night we gathered around the fire, telling stories and enjoying each other's company. It was a magical experience that we will never forget.

These memories remind us of the importance of perseverance and hard work, and how they can lead to incredible achievements. They also show us the value of family and community, and how they can bring us together in times of need.

In conclusion, I want to thank everyone who has supported me throughout my life. Your kindness and generosity have meant the world to me, and I am grateful for all that you have done.

Thank you for taking the time to read this letter. I hope that it has given you a glimpse into my life and experiences. If you have any questions or comments, please feel free to reach out to me.

Sincerely,

[Your Name]
